sentences: Laps hoidis oma sõrme peale sõrmust.
context: The Estonian word 'sõrmust' is an elative case form of 'sõrmus' (ring). The elative case indicates movement from within or origin from something. It can be translated as 'from the ring' or 'out of the ring' in English. This form shows motion away from a location - specifically coming out from inside a ring.
